intro: Hoya wayetii, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its waxy, thick leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms in shades of pink and white, often resembling coral in appearance. Hoya wayetii is a trailing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular among plant enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
